column5: Planning a trip to Crayon Lake. Wondering if anyone has fished it and what their perceptions were. I hear it is a smaller lake. Any idea on the lakes dimensions? I have a group of 6 and want to make sure there is sufficient space to fish and explore. Any insight would be greatly appreciated. Tight lines everyone! Thanks!

Twin Lakes outfitter. i'd ask him first. there are several maps on his web site for that lake. Second, i'd mapquest the lake, zooming in/out to see features. It will also have the distance in lower right corner and you can get good feel for how big the lake is.
Here it is on the far left of the screenshot. It appears that the main lake is about 2 miles long and about 1/2 mile wide. To put it in perspective, I also included Ogoki Lake.
A picture is worth a 1,000 words! Yup, it is a pretty small body of water comparatively. Thank you
I believe that there are blue walleye in that lake. So we expect to see pics of some when you return from your trip.
I am hearing the same thing. One of the reasons the lake sounds so interesting.
Why are the walleye blue? Are they depressed?
